server.network

Class DefaultProtocol

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.network.Protocol
      • server.network.DefaultProtocol

  • public final class DefaultProtocol
extends Protocol
    The implementation of the default protocol specified within the work-group INF-3.
    Author:
    ciske

      Handles the raw incoming data.
      void sendAccept()
      Should never be called in this Protocol implementation.
      void sendCannotChallenge(java.lang.String reason)
      Send a message to the client to notify him he cannot challenge the player he requested to challenge.

      Send to the client to notify him his challenge response failed.

      Send a notification to the client that another player has challenged him.

      Send all the stateChange commands to the client to build an initial list of the states and names of other clients.

      Send the doneMove command to the client to signal a player has performed a move.

      Send the gameDraw command to the client to signal the game has has ended in a draw.

      Send the gameWon command to the client to signal the game has been won by a player.

      Send a global chat message to the client.

      Send the invalidMove command to the client to signal the player his move wasn't valid.

      Send a local chat message to the client.
      void sendNotYourMove()
      Send the notYourMove command to the client to signal the player he tried to perform a move when it wasn't his turn.
      void sendOpponentDisconnected(java.lang.String name)
      Send the opponentDisconnected command to the client to signal that one of the players in the current game has disconnected.
      void sendRequestMove(java.lang.String playerName)
      Send the requestMove command to the client to signal which player has to make the next move.
      void sendStartGame(java.lang.String startingPlayer, java.lang.String otherPlayer)
      Send the startGame command to the client to signal a new game has been started.
      void sendStateChange(java.lang.String playerName, PlayerState state)
      Send the stateChange command to the client to signal that the state of another player has changed.

      Returns whether this protocol instance supports challenging.
